thread.title: Armada announces 2016 ticket pricing; all home games to be played at Baseball Grounds
thread.title_full: Armada announces 2016 ticket pricing; all home games to be played at Baseball Grounds

author: Clayton Freeman
title: Armada announces 2016 ticket pricing; all home games to be played at Baseball Grounds
text:
Armada announces 2016 ticket pricing; all home games to be played at Baseball Grounds 
By Clayton Freeman Wed, Oct 7, 2015 @ 5:47 pm Photos Fran Ruchalski/For the Florida Times-Union Jacksonville Armada Defender Lucas Trejo redirects the ball with a jumping kick in the first half as the Armada and the Indy Eleven played to a 1-1 tie at Community First Park in Jacksonville on Saturday, October 3, 2015. 
The Jacksonville Armada announced its ticket pricing for the 2016 North American Soccer League season Wednesday, and also confirmed an exhibition rematch of the club's inaugural game. 
Unlike last year, all 16 Jacksonville home games in the league are currently scheduled for the Baseball Grounds. 
"We're focused on developing the park as our home," Armada president Steve Livingstone said. "The fans like it and the setup is good." 
The Armada's exhibition and regular-season debuts in 2015 were both held at EverBank Field. 
The club also announced that it will again play a preseason match against the Philadelphia Union of Major League Soccer, likely during February, at the Baseball Grounds. 
Season tickets for 2016 will begin at $170 for 17 games, which reflects the same per-game cost as 2015. 
Prices for several seating sections - D2, D3, D4, 106 to 113, 118 and 120 - move into less expensive tiers in the 2016 season ticket plan, which has eight pricing tiers instead of 10. 
"When you're in the first year of any operation like this, there's some evaluation that goes on... by eliminating a couple of price levels in some seating, we'll be in better position to deliver value," Livingstone said. 
The plan also includes a new 25-month ticket plan covering the 2016 and 2017 seasons and an optional additional parking plan - $85 for 17 home matches - available to season ticket holders.
